result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Of the Preliminary Hearing held on June 13, 2016 before the Honorable David J Wambach
Of the Status Conference held on May 24, 2016 before the Honorable David J Wambach
Transcript of June 27th, 2016 Plea and Sentencing Hearing held before the Honorable Judge David Wambach.
with attached Victim Impact Statement
Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 15CF405 & 15CF427 called together at 8:18 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Scott A Smith in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall confirms victim rights compliance, submits victim impact statement & informs the Court that Miss Wild is present and wishes to address the Court
Court finds Chapter 950 compliance

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered to charge in 15CF427; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #15CF405, jeopardy attaches and further prosecution is barred
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses uncharged referral 16JE746 (dov: 2/29/16) theft, jeopardy attaches and further prosecution is barred
Statements by Marilyn Wild; Sentencing Arguments by Counsel

To the charge in Case 15CF427, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, and adopts the conditions as set forth in the criminal case settlement form, which include:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment per Agent
--No possesssion of any controlled substances without a prescription
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--Fine and/or costs
--DNA Surcharge
--Other costs/fees
--No direct/indirect contact with Marilyn WIld
--The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety
--The defendant shall not be present in any bar, tavern or liquor store
--The defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia
--The defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol
--The defendant shall not engage in any acts or threats of violence
--Restitution of $2377.50 payable to Marilyn Wild (15CF427 & 15CF405)
--Restitution of $175 payable to Junk & Disorderly (victim in 16JE754) uncharged read-in

EXCEPT THE COURT ORDERS INSTEAD OF 30 DAYS JAIL:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, withOUT Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith
Court determines that Mr. Smith has previously submitted a DNA Sample and does not order one to be taken

Days credit for time already served: 117 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 9:00 am
Sent to Defendant 1) NOH//sent to LKA
State's
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2016 at 08:10 am.
made by Defense

Cases 15CF405 and 15CF427 called together at 9:12am [mo]
Defendant Scott A Smith in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

As to Both Cases:
Mr. Smith  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--Atty. De La Rosa demands a speedy trial
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Atty. De La Rosa requests a plea/sentencing date.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

The Court and Counsel discuss procedural posture of case, preliminary hearings to remain as scheduled.

Cases 15CF405 & 15CF427 called at 1:20 pm [sf]
Defendant Scott A Smith in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will apoint counsel). ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
DOB verified. New Address information provided.
As to both cases:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $500.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Marilyn Wilde
-No presence at the residence of Marilyn Wilde in Lake Mills or any place she may temporarily occupy

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:26 pm
